revision.text:
{{For|the Dongfeng 11 diesel locomotive|China Railways DF11}} {{Refimprove|date=July 2012}} {{Infobox Weapon |is_missile=yes |name = Dong Feng 11 |image =[[File:DF-11 TEL vehicle -1.jpg|300px|Dong Feng 11]] |type = [[SRBM]] |vehicle_range =
* DF-11：300+ km{{Cite journal | title= Military Power of the People's Republic of China 2008 |url=http://www.defenselink.mil/pubs/pdfs/China_Military_Report_08.pdf | publisher=Office of the Secretary of Defense |page=66 (p66 of PDF) | postscript= }} * DF-11A：700+ km |filling = One, with [[Maneuverable reentry vehicle]]s |yield = |engine = single-stage solid-propellant rocket |guidance = [[Astro-inertial guidance]] (including [[ring-laser gyroscope]]) + [[Beidou Navigation Satellite System|Beidou]] |cep = ? |speed = |length = 11.25 m |diameter = 0.86 m |weight = ? |payload_capacity = ? |manufacturer = Academy of Rocket Motors Technology |unit_cost = |service = |used_by = [[People's Republic of China|PRC]] |launch_platform=Road-mobile [[Transporter erector launcher|TEL]] }} The '''Dong-Feng 11''' (a.k.a. M-11, CSS-7) is a short-range ballistic missile developed by the People's Republic of China. == History == The DF-11 is a road-mobile [[short-range ballistic missile]] (SRBM) designed by Wang Zhenhua at the Sanjiang Missile Corporation (also known as the 066 Base) in the late 1970s. == Description == The DF-11 has range of 300 km with an 800 kg payload. An improved DF-11A version has increased range of >825 km.[http://www.softwar.net/dongfeng.html Dong Feng - East Wind/Julang - Great Wave] The range of the M-11 does not violate the limits set by the [[Missile Technology Control Regime]] (MTCR). Unlike previous [[China|Chinese]] [[ballistic missile]]s, the DF-11 use [[solid fuel]], which greatly reduces launch preparation time (15-30 min). [[liquid fuel|Liquid-fueled]] missiles such as the DF-5 require up to 2 hours of pre-launch preparation. The upgraded DF-11B has been revealed as well.http://www.jamestown.org/single/?tx_ttnews%5Btt_news%5D=45313&no_cache=1#.V5rpIFJriTc Estimates on the number of DF-11s in service vary between 500 and 600.[http://www.globalsecurity.org/wmd/world/china/df-11.htm DF-11 (CSS-7)] GlobalSecurity.org[http://www.sinodefence.com/strategic/missile/df11.asp DongFeng 11 (CSS-7) Short-Range Ballistic Missile] Sinodefence.com The launch vehicle is made by [[Wanshan Special Vehicle]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! [http://missilethreat.com/missiles/df-11-11a-css-7/ DF-11/-11A (CSS-7)] - Missilethreat.com[http://weaponsystems.net/weaponsystem/DD06%20-%20DF-11%20(CSS-7).html DF-11] - Weaponsystems.net ! DF-11 ! DF-11A |- | Diameter | colspan=2|
{{convert|0.8|m|ft|abbr=on}}
|- | Length | {{convert|7.5|m|ft|abbr=on}} | {{convert|8.5|m|ft|abbr=on}} |- | Weight | {{convert|3800|kg|lb|abbr=on}} | {{convert|4200|kg|lb|abbr=on}} |- | Payload | {{convert|800|kg|lb|abbr=on}} | {{convert|500|kg|lb|abbr=on}} |- | Range | {{convert|280-350|km|mi|abbr=on}} | {{convert|530-600|km|mi|abbr=on}} or
{{convert|700-825|km|mi|abbr=on}} (Unconfirmed) |- | [[circular error probability|CEP]] | 500–600 m | 200 m ([[inertial navigation|INS]])
20–30 m ([[GPS]]) |- |} == Exports == [[China]] is known to have exported DF-11s to [[Pakistan]], which served as the basis for the [[Shaheen missile|Shaheen-1]] and [[Shaheen-II|Shaheen-2]] [[missile]]s. == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.sinodefence.com/strategic/missile/df11.asp Sinodefense description] {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=DF-11 |before=? |after=? |years=?}} {{s-end}} {{Chinese_Missiles}} [[Category:Ballistic missiles of the People's Republic of China]] [[Category:Weapons of the People's Republic of China]] [[Category:Short-range ballistic missiles]] [[it:Dongfeng#Dongfeng 11 (CSS-7)]] [[pl:Dongfeng (pocisk)#Dongfeng 11 (CSS-7)]] [[ru:Дунфэн (ракета)#Дунфэн 11 (CSS-7)]]
